com.gemalto.idp.mobile.otp.cap

Interface CapDevice


  • public interface CapDevice
    An interface defining a device that generates CAP based OTPs.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods

      Check if amount is required for a mode 1 operation (getOtpMode1(com.gemalto.idp.mobile.authentication.AuthInput, com.gemalto.idp.mobile.core.util.SecureString, com.gemalto.idp.mobile.core.util.SecureString, java.util.Currency)).

    • Method Detail

      • isMode1AmountRequired

        boolean isMode1AmountRequired()
        Check if amount is required for a mode 1 operation (getOtpMode1(com.gemalto.idp.mobile.authentication.AuthInput, com.gemalto.idp.mobile.core.util.SecureString, com.gemalto.idp.mobile.core.util.SecureString, java.util.Currency)).

        This method is affected by the IAF value. For example, an IAF of 0x70 does not include the amount while 0xA0 includes the amount

        Returns:
        true if amount is required

      • isMode1CurrencyRequired

        boolean isMode1CurrencyRequired()
        Check if currency is required for a mode 1 operation (getOtpMode1(com.gemalto.idp.mobile.authentication.AuthInput, com.gemalto.idp.mobile.core.util.SecureString, com.gemalto.idp.mobile.core.util.SecureString, java.util.Currency)).

        This method is affected by the IAF value. For example, an IAF of 0x70 does not include the currency while 0x80 includes the amount

        Returns:
        true if currency is required

      • getOtpMode1

        SecureString getOtpMode1(AuthInput authInput,
                         SecureString challenge,
                         SecureString amount,
                         java.util.Currency currency)
                  throws IdpException
        Creates a mode 1 OTP. The typical use case of this OTP is for purchasing items from a merchant.
        Parameters:
        authInput - the AuthInput
        challenge - the merchant challenge: An unpredictable number of up to 8 hexdecimal digits
        amount - the amount. If isMode1AmountRequired() returns true the argument is required. Otherwise the argument is ignored.
        currency - the currency of the transaction. If isMode1CurrencyRequired() returns true the argument is required. Otherwise the argument is ignored.
        Returns:
        the mode 1 OTP
        Throws:
        IdpRuntimeException - when there is a cryptography operation failure.
        IdpException - this is generic exception, you can directly catch this exception or catch each specific exception below.
        IdpStorageException - when there is a database operation failure.
        WrappedCounterException - when the ATC/counter reaches its maximum value.
        DeviceFingerprintException - when the token's fingerprint checksum does not match.
        PasswordManagerException - when the TOKEN domain is not logged in (using one of the password managers)
        IdpAuthException - when the authentication mode is not supported by the token.
        Since:
        4.0

      • getOtpMode2

        SecureString getOtpMode2(AuthInput authInput)
                  throws IdpException
        Creates a mode 2 OTP. The typical use case of this mode is for simple authentication.
        Parameters:
        authInput - the AuthInput
        Returns:
        the mode 2 OTP
        Throws:
        IdpRuntimeException - when there is a cryptography operation failure.
        IdpException - this is generic exception, you can directly catch this exception or catch each specific exception below.
        IdpStorageException - when there is a database operation failure.
        WrappedCounterException - when the ATC/counter reaches its maximum value.
        DeviceFingerprintException - when the token's fingerprint checksum does not match.
        PasswordManagerException - when the TOKEN domain is not logged in (using one of the password managers)
        IdpAuthException - when the authentication mode is not supported by the token.
        Since:
        4.0

      • getOtpMode2Tds

        SecureString getOtpMode2Tds(AuthInput authInput,
                            java.util.List<SecureString> dataToSign)
                     throws IdpException
        Creates a mode 2 transaction data signature OTP. The typical use case of this mode is for signing a set of transaction data. One such example is to sign the destination bank account in a transaction.
        Parameters:
        authInput - the AuthInput
        dataToSign - the list of data to be signed, data should only contain digits, maximum 10 digit per data and maximum 10 data fields in the list. Don't pass empty data, at least one non-empty data is required.
        Returns:
        the mode 2 TDS OTP
        Throws:
        IdpRuntimeException - when there is a cryptography operation failure.
        IdpException - this is generic exception, you can directly catch this exception or catch each specific exception below.
        IdpStorageException - when there is a database operation failure.
        WrappedCounterException - when the ATC/counter reaches its maximum value.
        DeviceFingerprintException - when the token's fingerprint checksum does not match.
        PasswordManagerException - when the TOKEN domain is not logged in (using one of the password managers)
        IdpAuthException - when the authentication mode is not supported by the token.
        Since:
        4.0

      • getOtpMode3

        SecureString getOtpMode3(AuthInput authInput,
                         SecureString challenge)
                  throws IdpException
        Creates a mode 3 OTP. The typical use case of this mode is for challenge/response. One such example is to log into a bank's website.
        Parameters:
        authInput - the AuthInput
        challenge - the login challenge: An unpredictable number of up to 8 hexdecimal digits
        Returns:
        the mode 3 OTP
        Throws:
        IdpRuntimeException - when there is a cryptography operation failure
        IdpException - this is generic exception, you can directly catch this exception or catch each specific exception below.
        IdpStorageException - when there is a database operation failure
        WrappedCounterException - when the ATC/counter reaches its maximum value.
        DeviceFingerprintException - when the token's fingerprint checksum does not match.
        PasswordManagerException - when the TOKEN domain is not logged in (using one of the password managers)
        IdpAuthException - when the authentication mode is not supported by the token.
        Since:
        4.0
